intro: Anthephora kotschyi, commonly known as the mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Anthephora kotschyi is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
